meanings.definition: Cause (an event or situation) to happen or exist.
meanings.sent1: Her loud scream was triggering the car alarm.
meanings.sent2: The storm triggered a power outage in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance triggered laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news triggered a wave of panic among the students.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies triggered memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: Evoke or provoke (a reaction or emotion).
meanings.sent1: The sad movie scene was triggering tears in the audience.
meanings.sent2: His apology triggered forgiveness from his friend.
meanings.sent3: The funny meme triggered a burst of laughter from her.
meanings.sent4: The old song triggered nostalgia for the good old days.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset triggered a sense of peace and calm.

meanings.sent1: Pressing the red button triggers the alarm system.
meanings.sent2: The key card triggered the automatic door to open.
meanings.sent3: The motion sensor triggered the lights to turn on.
meanings.sent4: The timer triggered the sprinklers to start watering the garden.
meanings.sent5: The remote control triggers the toy car to move forward.
